curfewsSetting.modalContentc: Your Subaru's systems run on Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). Currently, it is not possible to set a curfew duration that begins in one day and ends during the next day. For this reason, you are not able to set a curfew duration that begins at or before 12 a.m. UTC (7 p.m. EST) and ends after 12 a.m. the next day. UTC. Please ensure that your curfew duration occurs completely before 12 a.m. UTC or completely after 12 a.m. UTC.

demo.featureNotInDemo: This feature is not available in Demo Mode.
demo.oilWarningDescription: The Engine Oil Level light indicates the oil level may be low. Park your vehicle on a level surface, turn off the vehicle, wait at least 5 minutes and then check the engine oil level. If it's low, add oil according to the directions in your Owner's Manual. If the light does not turn off after you add oil, or if the light illuminates and the engine oil level is normal when checked, you should contact your Subaru Dealer as soon as possible.
demo.airbagSystemDescription: The Airbag System light indicates there might be a potential problem with your vehicle's Supplemental Restraint System, which includes the airbags and seatbelts. For your safety, we recommend a full system check. Please contact your Subaru dealer right away.
demo.absDescription: The ABS light indicates there might be a potential problem with your vehicle's Anti-Lock Braking System. Your vehicle's conventional brake system will continue to operate normally. To be safe, you should contact your Subaru dealer as soon as possible.

maintenanceSchedule.maintenanceInterval: Based on your vehicle's estimated mileage and service history you may be due for the following maintenance interval:
maintenanceSchedule.contactRetailer: Please contact your preferred dealer for next service details.
maintenanceSchedule.recommendedMaintenance: The most accurate recommended maintenance intervals are based on mileage or time elapsed since last service - whichever occurs first. For simplicity, the intervals shown are based on mileage only and are the recommended minimums. More frequent maintenance may be needed depending on road conditions, weather and individual driving habits*, to name a few. See your Warranty & Maintenance Booklet for more details.
maintenanceSchedule.severeDrivingConditionList:
• Repeated short distance driving.
  • Driving on rough and/ or muddy roads.
  • Driving in dusty conditions.
  • Driving in extremely cold weather.
  • Driving in areas where road salts or other corrosive materials are used.
  • Living in coastal areas.
  • Repeated trailer towing.
maintenanceSchedule.selectScheduleMessage: Please select a maintenance schedule to view the respective schedule.
maintenanceSchedule.changeMaintenanceMessage: Please contact your dealer if you think, based on the driving conditions above, you should be on a severe maintenance plan.
maintenanceSchedule.apiNextServiceError: We are currently experiencing issues and cannot retrieve your current maintenance interval at this time. Please contact customer service at 1 (800) 894-4212 for assistance.
maintenanceSchedule.apiPutSeveritySuccess: Your maintenance type has been updated with your preferred dealer.
maintenanceSchedule.apiPutServerityError1: Services are currently unavailable and your maintenance type could not be updated. The issue should be resolved shortly.
maintenanceSchedule.apiPutServerityError2: We are currently experiencing some issues and cannot update your maintenance type at this time. Please contact customer service at 1 (800) 894-4212 to resolve this issue.
maintenanceSchedule.modalChangeToSevere: Do you want to change your Maintenance Schedule from Normal to Severe driving conditions?
maintenanceSchedule.modalChangeToNormal: Do you want to change your Maintenance Schedule from Severe to Normal driving conditions?
maintenanceSchedule.currentScheduleTypeNormalDescription: Select Severe if you operate the vehicle for repeated short distance driving, regularly drive on rough and/or muddy roads, drive in dusty conditions or extremely cold weather, repeatedly tow trailers, drive in areas where road salts or other corrosive materials are used, or live in a coastal area.
maintenanceSchedule.currentScheduleTypeSevereDescription: Select Normal if you do not operate the vehicle for repeated short distance driving, regularly drive on rough and/or muddy roads, drive in dusty conditions or extremely cold weather, repeatedly tow trailers, drive in areas where road salts or other corrosive materials are used, or live in a coastal area.
maintenanceSchedule.beyondListedIntervals: To continue the Maintenance Schedule beyond the listed intervals, see your Warranty & Maintenance Booklet.
maintenanceSchedule.careConnectDealerError: Your preferred dealer is not currently configured in MySubaru to supply maintenance information. Please contact Subaru of Hawaii at {{Phone Number Here}} for your current maintenance interval and maintenance schedule.

warrantyFaqs.title: Warranty FAQs
warrantyFaqs.basicWarrantyInfo: Subaru's basic warranty covers any repairs needed to correct defects in material or workmanship reported during the applicable warranty period and which occur under normal use:
warrantyFaqs.basicWarrantyInfoListItem1: In any part of your Subaru
warrantyFaqs.basicWarrantyInfoListItem2: In any Genuine Subaru Optional Accessories installed on the car prior to delivery
warrantyFaqs.warrantyPeriodBegin: When does the warranty period begin?
warrantyFaqs.warrantyPeriodBeginInfo: Warranty coverage begins on the date the car is delivered to the first retail purchaser. If the car was used as a demonstrator or company vehicle before being sold at retail, warranty coverage begins on the date the car was first placed in such service.
warrantyFaqs.warrantiesInfo1: These warranties are made by Subaru Canada, Inc.  and apply only if the car was imported or distributed by Subaru Canada, Inc. and sold to the first retail purchaser by an Authorized Subaru Dealer in Canada.
warrantyFaqs.warrantiesInfo2: Any and all repairs must be performed by an authorized Subaru dealer located in Canada or the United States. Every owner of the car during the warranty period shall be entitled to the benefits of these warranties. In emergency situations where no  authorized Subaru dealer is available, minor repairs can be made by any available service facility.  Please consult with your Subaru dealer about these specific warranty conditions.

warranty.title: Warranty
warranty.addedSecurityPlans: Subaru Added Security plans are extended service agreements designed to protect your Subaru beyond the coverage provided by your original manufacturer's warranty. They are exclusively for Subaru vehicles and backed by the company that cares most about your long-term satisfaction, Subaru.
warranty.disclaimerInfo: Coverage and agreements can vary province by province. Please refer to your actual agreement for coverage terms and conditions. If you feel you may have purchased coverage and it's not showing here, please review your paperwork. You may have purchased coverage that is not backed by Subaru. If so, please contact your Subaru dealer for information on how to change programs to the ONLY program backed by Subaru - Added Security.
warranty.summary: This chart summarizes your warranty coverage since the original date of purchase.
warranty.warrantyDescription1:
Subaru New Vehicle Limited Warranty
This warranty covers basic and major components for 36 months or 60,000 km.
warranty.warrantyDescription2:
Subaru Major Component Warranty
This warranty continues to cover major components to 60 months or 100,000 km.
warranty.warrantyDescription3:
Subaru Surface Corrosion Limited Warranty
This warranty covers surface corrosion to visible painted body panels for 36 months or 60,000 km.
warranty.warrantyDescription4:
Subaru Anti-Perforation Limited Warranty
This warranty covers perforation due to the corrosion of body panels for 60 months, regardless of how many kilometres are driven.
warranty.warrantyDescription5:
Subaru Emission Control System Limited Warranty
This warranty covers the majority of emissions components for 36 months or 60,000 km.
warranty.warrantyDescription6:
Subaru Emissions Performance Warranty
This warranty covers the repairs needed to comply with legislated emissions performance standards for 36 months or 60,000 km.
warranty.warrantyDescription7:
Subaru Extended Emissions System Warranty
Federal Emissions Extended Defect Warranty
warranty.warrantyDescription8:
Subaru Parts and Accessories Limited Warranty
This warranty covers Genuine Subaru Parts and Accessories.

vehicleInformation.mileageDescription4: MySubaru provides an estimated mileage in an effort to give timely maintenance notifications. airbag.description: The Airbag System light indicates there might be a potential problem with your vehicle's Supplemental Restraint System, which includes the airbags and seatbelts. For your safety, we recommend a full system check. Please contact your Subaru Dealer right away.

awd.description: The AWD light indicates there might be a potential problem with the All-Wheel Drive system in your vehicle. Two common things can adversely affect the AWD: excessively low tire inflation pressure; and driving on tires with different diameters, such as using the temporary spare tire longer than recommended. For your peace of mind, and ours, please contact your Subaru Dealer as soon as possible.

abs.description: The ABS light indicates there might be a potential problem with your vehicle's Anti-Lock Braking System. Your vehicle's conventional brake system will continue to operate normally. To be safe, you should contact your Subaru Dealer as soon as possible.

oilTemp.description: The AT Oil Temperature light indicates there might be a potential problem with your vehicle's automatic transmission. If it's illuminated but not flashing, the transmission fluid may be too hot. If it is flashing, it might mean the transmission control system is not working properly. In either case, you should contact your Subaru Dealer right away.

blindspot.description: The Blind-Spot Detection/Rear Cross Traffic System light indicates there might be a potential problem with your vehicle's peripheral sensors, they may not be operating. Please contact your Subaru Dealer as soon as possible.

chargeSystem.description: If this light illuminates when the engine is running, it may indicate that the charging system is not working properly. If the light illuminates while driving or does not turn off after the engine starts, stop the engine at the first safe opportunity and check the alternator belt. If the belt is loose, broken or if the belt is in good condition but the light remains illuminated, contact your nearest SUBARU dealer immeditely.

engineFail.description: The Check Engine light indicates a potential problem with your vehicle's engine control system. It could be something minor like a loose gas cap, or it may indicate a more serious condition. We recommend that you contact your Subaru Dealer right away.

ebd.description: The Brake light indicates there might be a potential problem with your vehicle's brake system. If your parking brake is released, it could be the brake fluid is low or the brake pads are worn. If at all in doubt, about whether the brakes are operating properly, do not drive the vehicle. Have your vehicle towed to the nearest Subaru dealer for repair. Please contact your Subaru Dealer, who can help diagnose and repair your vehicle.

pkgBrake.description: The Electronic Parking Brake light flashes when the system is malfunctioning. If the light flashes, promptly park in a safe location right away and contact your Subaru Dealer. The light remains illuminated when the parking brake cannot be released even if the parking brake switch is pushed. If at all in doubt, about whether the brakes are operating properly, do not drive the vehicle. Have your vehicle towed to the nearest Subaru dealer for repair. Please contact your Subaru Dealer, who can help diagnose and repair your vehicle.

oilWarning.description: The Engine Oil Level light indicates the oil level may be low. Park your vehicle on a level surface, turn off the vehicle, wait at least 5 minutes and then check the engine oil level. If it's low, add oil according to the directions in your Owner's Manual. If the light does not turn off after you add oil, or if the light illuminates and the engine oil level is normal when checked, you should contact your Subaru Dealer as soon as possible.

eyesight.description: The EyeSight System light indicates there might be a potential problem with the EyeSight Driver Assist Technology in your vehicle. The system monitors Pre-Collision Warning, Braking and Throttle Management, Lane Departure, and Adaptive Cruise Control. If EyeSight senses something is off, it sends a warning alert. For your peace of mind, and ours, please contact your Subaru Dealer right away.

hybridSystem.description: The Hybrid light indicates there might be a potential problem with your vehicle's hybrid electric drive system. For your safety, we recommend a full system check. Please contact a Subaru Dealer as soon as possible.

iss.description:
The Auto Start Stop warning light will flash when the Auto Start Stop system is malfunctioning. We recommend that you contact your authorized SUBARU dealer for an inspection.

If the Auto Start Stop warning light does not turn off after the engine has started, the Auto Start Stop system may be malfunctioning. We recommend that you contact your authorized SUBARU dealer for an inspection.

After the vehicle is stopped, the engine may not automatically stop under the following conditions.
  • The vehicle is stopped on a road with a steep slope.
  • The vehicle is stopped by hard braking.
  • Negative pressure in the brake booster is not sufficient.
  • The brake pedal is not fully depressed.

oilPres.description:
If the Oil Pressure light illuminates when the engine is running, it may indicate that the engine oil pressure is low and the lubricating system is not working properly. If the light illuminates while driving or does not turn off after the engine starts, stop the engine at the first safe opportunity on a level surface, wait at least 5 minutes after stopping the engine, and check the engine oil level. If the oil level is low, add oil immediately. If the engine oil is at the proper level but the light remains illuminated, contact your nearest Subaru Dealer right away.

NOTE: If you have a manual transmission vehicle, this light may illuminate as the result of stalling the engine. If the light remains illuminated once the engine has been started again, please follow the instructions above.

passairbag.description: The Front Passenger Airbag System light indicates there might be a potential problem with your vehicle's front passenger Supplemental Restraint System, which includes the airbags and seatbelts. Until you have this condition resolved, we recommend to not have anyone sit in the front passenger seat. For your safety, we recommend a full system check. Please contact your Subaru Dealer right away.

warning.description: The Front Passenger Airbag System light indicates there might be a potential problem with your vehicle's front passenger Supplemental Restraint System, which includes the airbags and seatbelts. Until you have this condition resolved, we recommend to not have anyone sit in the front passenger seat. For your safety, we recommend a full system check. Please contact your Subaru Dealer right away.

epas.description: The Power Steering Warning Light indicates there might be a potential problem with your vehicle's power steering. You may notice some resistance when steering, but you'll still be able to control your vehicle. Drive carefully to the nearest Subaru Dealer and have the vehicle inspected right away.

revBrake.description: The RAB System light indicates there might be a problem with your vehicle's Reverse Automatic Braking System. Please contact your Subaru Dealer as soon as possible.

telematics.description: The STARLINK<sup>®</sup> Emergency Service such as Automatic Crash Notification, SOS call, Stolen Vehicle Locator and Enhanced Roadside Assistance—may not be available. Since these functions deal primarily with your safety, security and remote services, it's important you stay connected. Please contact your Subaru Dealer right away.

tpms.description: The TPMS light indicates one or more of your tires is underinflated. You should stop and check your tires as soon as possible, and inflate them to the proper pressure. Underinflation reduces fuel efficiency and tire life, and may affect the vehicle's handling and stopping ability. After you add air and drive the vehicle at least 25 mph (40 km/h), the TPMS will re-check the inflation pressures to see if they are above the severe low-pressure threshold. If the warning light doesn't turn off a few minutes later, you should contact your Subaru Dealer as soon as possible.

vdc.description: The VDC light indicates there might be a potential problem with the system that monitors and analyzes steering angle, engine speed and braking conditions. For your peace of mind, and ours, please contact your Subaru Dealer as soon as possible.

washer.description: The Windshield Washer Fluid Level light indicates the windshield washer fluid is low. It's easy to do…go for it, just make sure you turn off your engine first. For a quick reference on adding windshield washer fluid, check the Owner's Manual. For additional assistance, please visit your Subaru Dealer and ask for help.

tipFaqs.title: FAQs
tipFaqs.howDoIAutoLogin: How do I opt out of auto login?
tipFaqs.howDoIAutoLoginAnswer: All you have to do is select log out in the side menu and your auto login settings (username and password) will be cleared.
tipFaqs.howDoIUpdateMyPin: How do I update my PIN?
tipFaqs.howDoIUpdateMyPinAnswer: From the menu, select "My Profile" and then select "Change PIN" if you know your previous PIN. Otherwise, select "Forgot PIN" to reset your PIN.
tipFaqs.howDoIChangeMyUsername: How do I change my username?
tipFaqs.howDoIChangeMyUsernameAnswer: From the menu, select "My Profile" and then select "Contact Information". Scroll to the Email Address section and click "Edit Email". Then select the "Email Address" field and enter your new email address and confirm the email address and click "Save". You will then be asked to enter your password, enter your password and click "Submit".
tipFaqs.whatIsAnAuthorizedDeviceAnswer: Upon log in to the MySubaru App for the first time from a new device, you will be asked to answer one of your MySubaru security questions. Once you have successfully answered your security question, the device you are using will be saved so that you will not need to verify the device each time you log in. Occasionally MySubaru will ask you to re-authorize your device for security purposes.
tipFaqs.howDoIChangeMyFirstAndLastName: How do I change my first and last name?
tipFaqs.howDoIChangeMyFirstAndLastNameAnswer: First and last name cannot be changed in MySubaru. To update your first or last name please contact Subaru Customer Care at 1 (800) 894-4212.
tipFaqs.whatIsAnAuthorizedUser: What is an authorized user and how do I add one?
tipFaqs.whatIsAnAuthorizedUserAnswer1: Add an authorized user to your MySubaru Account to give them access to connected services, vehicle health reports and more. The authorized user will have their own MySubaru log in and be able to set their own preferences for when they receive notifications from SUBARU STARLINK<sup>®</sup> Connected Services. You can set up different levels of access for your authorized users so they can control all SUBARU STARLINK<sup>®</sup> Connected Services features or just a select set.
tipFaqs.whatIsAnAuthorizedUserAnswer2: To add an authorized user select "My Profile" in the menu navigation and then "Authorized Users". Click on "Add an Authorized User" and enter in details of the authorized user. If the authorized user does not have a MySubaru account, they will receive an email with details on how to finish their account set up. If they already have an existing MySubaru account, the vehicle they are authorized to access will be added to their existing account and they will be notified by email.
tipFaqs.howDoIRemoveAnAuthorizedUser: How do I remove an authorized user?
tipFaqs.howDoIRemoveAnAuthorizedUserAnswer: To remove an authorized user select "My Profile" in the menu navigation and then "Authorized Users". Locate the Authorized User you would like to remove and swipe the blade with their name on it to left. Select "Delete Contact" to remove your vehicle from their account.
tipFaqs.howDoIUpdateMyBillingInformation: How do I update my billing information?
tipFaqs.howDoIUpdateMyBillingInformationAnswer: Select "STARLINK<sup>®</sup>" in the menu navigation and then select "Manage Subscriptions". Open the "Billing Information / Profile" drop down and select the "Update Billing Information" button to update your billing information.
tipFaqs.howIsMyMileageUpdatedAnswer1: Your mileage will be automatically updated every 500 kilometres you travel.
tipFaqs.howIsMyMileageUpdatedAnswer2: Your mileage will be automatically updated after every ignition off.
tipFaqs.howIsMyMileageUpdatedAnswer3: When your vehicle is brought to an authorized Subaru Service Center, your mileage will be automatically updated in your MySubaru account.
tipFaqs.howIsMyMileageUpdatedAnswer4: You can update your mileage anytime in MySubaru by going to the vehicles page and selecting "edit".
tipFaqs.howDoISwitchBetweenVehiclesInAnAccount: How do I switch between vehicles in an account?
tipFaqs.howDoISwitchBetweenVehiclesInAnAccountAn: Select the menu and you will see the nickname of the vehicle you are currently viewing. Select that white tile to see a drop down list of the other vehicles on your account. Select the vehicle you wish to view information for.
tipFaqs.howDoIAddAnotherVehicleOnMyAccount: How do I add another vehicle on my account?
tipFaqs.howDoIAddAnotherVehicleOnMyAccountAnswer: Select the menu and you will see the nickname of the vehicle you are currently viewing. Select that white tile and select "Update My Vehicle Information". Select the "Add New Vehicle" button to add another vehicle to your account.
tipFaqs.howDoIChangeMyPreferredRetailer: How do I change my preferred dealer?
tipFaqs.howDoIChangeMyPreferredRetailerAnswer: Select "My Dealer" in the menu navigation. Locate the button that is center aligned titled "Find a Different Dealer". Enter the postal code or city, province of the Dealer you wish to change and select the name of the Dealer from the list. Locate the button titled "Make This Your Dealer" to change preferred dealers.
tipFaqs.howDoIScheduleAnAppointment: How do I schedule an appointment?
tipFaqs.howDoIScheduleAnAppointmentAnswer: Select "Vehicle Service & Maintenance" in the menu navigation and then select "Schedule Service". Select the button titled "Schedule a Service Appointment" to schedule an appointment at your preferred dealer.
tipFaqs.howDoICancelAnAppointment: How do I cancel an appointment?
tipFaqs.howDoICancelAnAppointmentAnswer: Select "Manage Subscriptions" in the menu navigation and then select "Subscription & Services". Open the "My SUBARU STARLINK<sup>®</sup> Subscriptions" drop down and select the "Manage Your Subscriptions" button.
tipFaqs.howDoIFindInformationAboutMyPreferredRet: How do I find information about my preferred dealer?
Select "My Profile" in the menu navigation and then select "My Dealer" to see details about your preferred dealer.
tipFaqs.howDoIRecordAPreviousServiceVisit: How do I record a previous service visit?
tipFaqs.howDoIRecordAPreviousServiceVisitAnswer: Select "Vehicle Service & Maintenance" in the menu navigation and then select "Enter Service Record".
tipFaqs.howDoIKnowWhatMyTirePressureIs: How do I know what my tire pressure is?
tipFaqs.howDoIKnowWhatMyTirePressureIsAnswer: Select "STARLINK<sup>®</sup>" in the menu navigation and then select "Vehicle Condition Check" from the menu drop down. The Vehicle Condition Check page will show you what the current tire pressure is for each tire.
tipFaqs.howLongWillMyCarRunWhenRemoteEngineStart: How long will my car run when remote engine start is in progress?

You can specify your runtime during the Remote Engine Start set up. Runtimes are either 3, 5, or 10 minute intervals with a maximum total of 20 minutes of runtime. After 20 minutes you will need to manually start your vehicle.
tipFaqs.howLongWillMyCarRunWhenRemoteClimateCont: How long will my car run when remote climate control is in progress?
You can specify your runtime during the Remote Climate Control set up. Runtimes are either 3, 5 minute or 10 minute intervals.
tipFaqs.canILockMyVehicleWithMyKeysInTheCar: Can I lock my vehicle with my keys in the car?
tipFaqs.canILockMyVehicleWithMyKeysInTheCarAnswe: Yes, you can lock your keys in the car using the Remote Lock feature. To unlock your car, use the Remote Unlock feature.
tipFaqs.howCloseDoIHaveToBeForRemoteServicesToWo: How close do I have to be for connected services to work?
As long as you have internet access on your device, and the vehicle has cellular coverage you can execute a remote service from anywhere in the world.
tipFaqs.ifIUnlockMyCarWillItAutomaticallyRelock: If I unlock my car will it automatically relock?
tipFaqs.ifIUnlockMyCarWillItAutomaticallyRelockA: Yes, your vehicle will automatically relock after 60 seconds if the door was not opened.
tipFaqs.whyWontMyCarStartCharging: Why won't my car start charging?
tipFaqs.whyWontMyCarStartChargingAnswer: If your vehicle has a Remote Battery Charging Timer schedule set, your vehicle will not start charging when it is plugged in, but will start on the next scheduled charge time. If you need to charge your vehicle now, use the Charge Now feature in the MySubaru website or MySubaru app.
tipFaqs.howDoIGetTheKeysOut: I've locked my keys in the car during Remote Climate Control. How do I get them out?
tipFaqs.howDoIGetTheKeysOutAnswer: Use the Remote Unlock feature in the MySubaru website or MySubaru app to unlock your vehicle.
tipFaqs.howDoIDowngradeAnswer: Select "STARLINK<sup>®</sup>" in the menu navigation and then select "Manage Subscriptions". Open the "My SUBARU STARLINK<sup>®</sup> Subscriptions" drop down and select the "Manage Your Subscriptions" button.
tipFaqs.howDoICancelASubscription: How do I cancel a subscription?
tipFaqs.howDoICancelASubscriptionAnswer: Select "Manage Subscriptions" in the menu navigation and then select "Subscription & Services". Open the "My SUBARU STARLINK<sup>®</sup> Subscriptions" drop down and select the "Manage Your Subscriptions" button.
tipFaqs.howDoICreateABoundaryAlert: How do I create/change a boundary alert?
tipFaqs.howDoICreateABoundaryAlertAnswer: From the home page, tap on "Driver Alerts Settings" and then tap on the "Boundary Alerts" button. Click the "+" to create a new boundary alert. To change an existing boundary alert, swipe the 3 dots next to the boundary name and select the "Edit Alert" button.
tipFaqs.howDoIKnowIfMyVehicleAlertsAreActive: How do I know if my vehicle alerts are active?
tipFaqs.howDoIKnowIfMyVehicleAlertsAreActiveAnsw: From the home page, tap on "Driver Alerts", select the button for the alert you wish to view. Active alerts will have a green checkmark next to them. To activate an alert, click on the gray circle next to the alert name and then enter your PIN.
tipFaqs.howDoICreateASpeedAlert: How do I create/change a speed alert?
tipFaqs.howDoICreateASpeedAlertAnswer: From the home page, tap on "Driver Alerts Settings" and then tap on the "Speed Alerts" button. Click the "+" to create a new speed alert. To change an existing speed alert, swipe the 3 dots next to the speed alert name and select the "Edit Alert" button.
tipFaqs.howDoICreateACurfewAlert: How do I create/change a curfew alert?
tipFaqs.howDoICreateACurfewAlertAnswer: From the home page, tap on "Driver Alerts Settings" and then tap on the "Curfew Alerts" button. Click the "+" to create a new curfew alert. To change an existing curfew alert, swipe the 3 dots next to the curfew alert name and select the "Edit Alert" button.
tipFaqs.howManyVehicleAlertsCanBeActiveAtOneTime: How many vehicle alerts can be active at one time?
One vehicle alert per feature (i.e.: Speed Alert, Curfew Alert, Boundary Alert) can be active at a time.
tipFaqs.whyDoINotHaveRemoteServices: Why do I not have connected services?
tipFaqs.whyDoINotHaveRemoteServicesAnswer1: Your vehicle is not equipped with SUBARU STARLINK® Connected Services. To learn more visit.
tipFaqs.whyDoINotHaveRemoteServicesAnswer2: You are not currently enrolled in SUBARU STARLINK<sup>®</sup> Connected Services. To enroll tap "Menu", then "STARLINK<sup>®</sup>" then "Manage Subscriptions". Click the "My Subaru STARLINK<sup>®</sup> Subscriptions" and then click "Subscribe Now".
tipFaqs.whyDoINotHaveRemoteServicesAnswer3: Your vehicle is not equipped with SUBARU STARLINK® Connected Services. To learn more visit.
tipFaqs.whyDoINotHaveDriverAlerts: Why do I not have driver alerts?
tipFaqs.whyDoINotHaveDriverAlertsAnswer: Your vehicle is not equipped with SUBARU STARLINK® Connected Services Driver Alerts. To learn more visit.
tipFaqs.whyDoINotHaveDriverAlertsAnswer1: The authorized user account that was set up for you, does not have access to Driver Alerts. Contact the Primary MySubaru account holder to modify your account permissions.
tipFaqs.whyDoINotHaveDriverAlertsAnswer2: You are not currently enrolled in SUBARU STARLINK<sup>®</sup> Connected Services. Please contact the primary owner to have them subscribe.
tipFaqs.howDoIUpdateMyCreditCard: How do I update my credit card?
tipFaqs.howDoIUpdateMyCreditCardAnswer: Click on "Manage Subscriptions" in the top menu navigation. Under the "My STARLINK<sup>®</sup> Subscriptions" section click on the blue link for "Update Billing Information". At the bottom of the page click on the button for "EDIT BILLING INFORMATION". Enter in your new credit card details and click "update". This credit card will be charged for future renewals and purchases.
tipFaqs.howDoIReportMyVehicleStolen: How do I report my vehicle stolen and initiate stolen vehicle recovery mode?
tipFaqs.howDoIReportMyVehicleStolenAnswer1: In the event your vehicle is ever stolen, file a police report immediately. Once the police report has been filed, contact SUBARU STARLINK® Connected Services Representative at 1 (800) 263-8802. SUBARU STARLINK® Connected Services Representative will initiate stolen vehicle recovery mode and immobilizer (if applicable) and work with the police to help recover your vehicle.
tipFaqs.howDoIReportMyVehicleStolenAnswer2: To learn more, check out this video.
tipFaqs.howDoISignUpForWifi: How do I sign up for my in vehicle WIFI Hotspot?
tipFaqs.howDoISignUpForWifiAnswer1: To sign up for your vehicle's WiFi Hotspot using the MySubaru app, select "STARLINK<sup>®</sup>" from the menu and then select "Manage Subscriptions". Scroll down to the section labelled "AT&T WiFi Subscription" and click on the arrow and then the "CREATE A NEW WIFI ACCOUNT" button. You will be directed to the WiFi Hotspot enrollment page. Click on "Sign Up" to create a new account and select a subscription.
tipFaqs.howDoISignUpForWifiAnswer2: To enroll in your vehicle, make sure your vehicle is turned on. On your head unit, click on "Settings" and scroll down to the section for "WiFi Hotspot". Make sure your Hotspot is set to "On". Click on the "WiFi Hotspot Settings" option on your head unit to find the name of the WiFi Hotspot and the password for the Hotspot.  Using a WiFi enabled device, connect to the WiFi Hotspot name listed on your head unit and enter the password. Upon connecting to the WiFi Hotspot, you will be redirected to the enrollment screens. Click on "Sign Up" to create a new account and select a subscription.
tipFaqs.howDoICancelMyWifi: How do I cancel my WIFI?
tipFaqs.howDoIEnablTouchID: How do I enable Touch ID?
tipFaqs.howDoIEnableFaceID: How do I enable Face ID?
tipFaqs.howDoIEnableFingerprint: How do I enable Face/Fingerprint Unlock?
tipFaqs.howDoIEnableFaceIDAnswer: To enable Face ID you can go to the settings page in the menu and turn Face ID on by tapping the toggle and entering your current PIN. You can also enable on the PIN panel of any remote function, by selecting "setup Face ID" and entering your current PIN.
tipFaqs.howDoIEnablTouchIDAnswer: To enable Touch ID you can go to the settings page in the menu and turn Touch ID on by tapping the toggle and entering your current PIN. You can also enable on the PIN panel of any remote function, by selecting "setup Touch ID" and entering your current PIN.
tipFaqs.howDoIEnableFingerprintAnswer: To enable Face/Fingerprint Unlock you can go to the settings page in the menu and turn Face/Fingerprint Unlock on by tapping the toggle and entering your current PIN. You can also enable on the PIN panel of any remote function, by selecting "setup Face/Fingerprint Unlock " and entering your current PIN.
tipFaqs.howDoIDisableTouchID: How do I disable Touch ID?
tipFaqs.howDoIDisableFaceID: How do I disable Face ID?
tipFaqs.howDoIDisableFingerprint: How do I disable Face/Fingerprint Unlock?
tipFaqs.howDoIDisableFaceIDAnswer: To disable Face ID you can go to the settings page in the menu and turn Face ID off by tapping the toggle and confirming you would like to disable.
tipFaqs.howDoIDisableTouchIDAnswer: To disable Touch ID you can go to the settings page in the menu and turn Touch ID off by tapping the toggle and confirming you would like to disable.
tipFaqs.howDoIDisableFingerprintAnswer: To disable Face/Fingerprint Unlock you can go to the settings page in the menu and turn Face/Fingerprint Unlock off by tapping the toggle and confirming you would like to disable.
tipFaqs.howDoIEnableBiometricsAnswer2a: settings page in the menu and turn
tipFaqs.howDoIEnableBiometricsAnswer3: on by tapping the toggle and entering your current PIN. You can also enable on the PIN panel of any remote function, by selecting "setup
tipFaqs.howDoIDisableBiometricsAnswer2a: settings page in the menu and turn
tipFaqs.howDoIDisableBiometricsAnswer3: off by tapping the toggle and confirming you would like to disable.
tipFaqs.howDoISetupAppleCarplay: How Do I Setup Apple Carplay?
tipFaqs.appleCarplayListItem1: Plug the iOS/Apple phone into the USB port of the vehicle. Ensure a quality OEM cable is being used.
tipFaqs.appleCarplayListItem3: Select Apple Carplay on the vehicle infotainment screen.
tipFaqs.appleCarplayListItem4: You will be brought to the home page of your phone in Apple Carplay.
tipFaqs.appleCarplayListItem5: For the latest on available Carplay apps and phone compatibility, please visit.
tipFaqs.appleCarplayListItem6: To ensure a great experience, Subaru recommends the below Carplay tips:
tipFaqs.appleCarplayListItem7: Use a high-quality OEM USB cable.
tipFaqs.appleCarplayListItem8: Ensure the iOS/Apple phone is fully up to date.
tipFaqs.appleCarplayListItem9: Ensure all other apps that work on Apple Carplay are up to date. Ex. (Pandora, Apple Maps, Spotify). Apple Carplay might not function correctly if one of these apps is outdated or having an issue. Apps can be updated in the "App Store" app.
tipFaqs.howDoISetupAndroidAuto: How Do I Setup Android Auto?
tipFaqs.androidAutoListItem1: Plug the Android phone into the USB port of the vehicle. Ensure a quality OEM cable is being used.
tipFaqs.androidAutoListItem2: For the first time, a welcome message will appear.
tipFaqs.androidAutoListItem4: From here, other prompts might appear. Agree to all.
tipFaqs.androidAutoListItem5: Android Auto might also need to download before working on the vehicle. Allow it to do so.
tipFaqs.androidAutoListItem6: On the vehicles infotainment screen, Android Auto should auto launch for the first time. If not select the Android Auto icon on the vehicle infotainment screen.
tipFaqs.androidAutoListItem7: Select "Show Me How" for a quick guide on using Android Auto or "Skip" if you want to start using the app right away.
tipFaqs.androidAutoListItem8: You will be brought to the home page of Android Auto for your phone.
tipFaqs.androidAutoListItem9: To ensure a great experience, Subaru recommends the below Android Auto tips:
tipFaqs.androidAutoListItem10: Use a high-quality OEM USB cable.
tipFaqs.androidAutoListItem11: Ensure the Android phone is fully up to date.
tipFaqs.androidAutoListItem12: Ensure the Android Auto App is up to date.
tipFaqs.androidAutoListItem13: Ensure all other apps that work on Android Auto are up to date. Ex. (Google Maps, Waze, Spotify). Android Auto might not function correctly if one of these apps is outdated or having an issue. Apps can be updated in the "Play Store" app.
tipFaqs.androidAutoListItem14: Visit the Android Auto website for the latest info, FAQs and device compatibility.
tipFaqs.whereDoIGetHelpAndSignUpForSxm: Where do I get help and sign up for SXM?
tipFaqs.whereDoIGetHelpAndSignUpForSxmAnswer: For the latest on SiriusXM and more info on subscriptions, please visit.
tipFaqs.authorizedUserAnswer: Add an authorized user to your MySubaru Account to give them access to remote services, vehicle health reports and more. The authorized user will have their own MySubaru log in and be able to set their own preferences for when they receive notifications from SUBARU STARLINK<sup>®</sup> Connected Services. You can set up different levels of access for your authorized users so they can control all STARLINK<sup>®</sup> features or just a select set.
tipFaqs.authorizedDeviceAnswer: The first time you log in to MySubaru with a device such as a computer, smartphone, or tablet, you must complete a two-step identification validation to authorize the device. You may elect to have the device remembered for future use, however you may be prompted periodically to reauthorize your device to help keep your MySubaru account secure.
tipFaqs.remoteStartAnswer: Using the MySubaru website or the MySubaru app, you can remotely start your vehicle from anywhere you have an internet connection. You can set the desired temperature and additional settings so that when you get to your vehicle it is set for your comfort. Note - Remote Start not available for vehicles with manual transmissions.
tipFaqs.locateVehicleAnswer: Using the MySubaru website or the MySubaru app, you can find your vehicle's specific location on a map.
tipFaqs.curfewAnswer: Using the MySubaru website or the MySubaru app, you can set a specific day and time range that your vehicle should not be turned on. If the vehicle is turned on when it should not be, you will receive a notification to your preferred communication channel (email, text or push).
tipFaqs.speedAlertAnswer: Using the MySubaru website or the MySubaru app, you can set a specific speed that your vehicle should not exceed. You can also set a threshold time to allow for the vehicle to reach that speed if they need to pass another vehicle. Once that threshold time has been exceeded over the speed you set, you will receive a notification to your preferred communication channel (email, text or push).
tipFaqs.boundaryAnswer: Using the MySubaru website or the MySubaru app, you can set a boundary on an area on a map that the vehicle should not enter or should not exit. If the vehicle violates this boundary, you will receive a notification to your preferred communication channel (email, text or push).
tipFaqs.conciergeAnswer: This service allows you to press the blue "i" button in vehicle and be connected to a SUBARU STARLINK<sup>®</sup> Connected Services. The concierge can search for Points of Interest and send them to the vehicle's navigation system (if applicable). The concierge can also assist with scheduling a service appointment at a Subaru Dealer.
tipFaqs.retailerAnswer: A dealer is an authorized Subaru dealer.
tipFaqs.howManyChargingSchedulesCanBeActiveAtOne: How many charging schedules can be active at one time?
You can set up to 3 active charging schedules at a time.
tipFaqs.emergencyContactAnswer: Emergency Contact information is used in case of an emergency when you are connected to a SUBARU STARLINK<sup>®</sup>  Connected Services Representative. You can set up to 3 Emergency Contacts and designate a primary contact who will be contacted first in the event of an emergency.
tipFaqs.preferredRetailerAnswer: Your Preferred Dealer is defaulted  to the dealer where you purchased your new Subaru or where you have taken it for service. You are able to change your Preferred Dealer at any time using MySubaru.
tipFaqs.vehicleAlertsAnswer: Vehicle alerts help you keep track of your vehicle and add peace of mind that the vehicle is not being operated when you don't want it to be, entering or exiting designated areas or travelling faster than you wish. Vehicle alerts can be configured, edited and deleted using MySubaru.
tipFaqs.chargeNowAnswer: When you need to charge your vehicle outside of any schedules you've set, utilize the "Charge Now" option in the MySubaru website and Mobile App. Selecting "Charge Now" from the MySubaru website and Mobile App sends a command to start your vehicle's charging cycle.
tipFaqs.remoteBatteryChargingTimerAnswer:
The Remote Battery Charging Timer screen is where you can set charging schedules for your vehicle, as well as see important information like the current charge of the battery, if the charging connector is plugged in or not and the charging status. When using Remote Battery Charging Timer, there are two charging schedule types for you to choose from that help to make sure that your vehicle's battery is charged and ready for your next adventure. Below are explanations of each charging schedule type:
  • Start Time Schedule - With this schedule your vehicle will start charging at the set time and finishes charging when fully charged.
  • Departure Time Schedule - Set your expected "Departure Time" and the vehicle will start charging to finish at the set time.

    • Creating a Charging Schedule:
    • Log on to the MySubaru website (MySubaru.ca) or MySubaru Mobile App.
    • Select "Connected Services".
    • Scroll to or Select "Remote Battery Charging Timer".
    • Select "Create a New Schedule".
    • Choose a schedule type (Start or Departure).
    • Select the hour and minutes you want, including AM and PM.
    • When the charging mode is set to "Departure time", the climate control system can be set to automatically operate according to the set time. Operation starts approximately 10 minutes before the set departure time.
tipFaqs.remoteClimateControlAnswer: Using the MySubaru website or the MySubaru app, you can remotely climatize your vehicle from anywhere you have an internet connection. You can set the desired temperature and additional settings so that when you get to your vehicle it is set for your comfort.

subaruCustomerCare.needAnswers: Need answers? We're here to help. For questions regarding your Subaru vehicle or dealer, please call or email.

stolenVehicle.stepsToLocateVehicle: If your vehicle is stolen, we can try to locate it. Here are the steps you need to take to initiate Stolen Vehicle Recovery Service.
stolenVehicle.fileAReport: File a stolen vehicle police report with your local authorities.
stolenVehicle.verifyYourIdentity: Contact SUBARU STARLINK® Connected Services Representative (1 (800) 263-8802). The agent will verify your identity, then ask for information about the police report you filed.
stolenVehicle.verifyWithLocalAuthorities: The agent will then verify with the local authorities that they are treating the vehicle as stolen.
stolenVehicle.vehiclePlacedInStolenMode: The vehicle will then be placed in Stolen Vehicle Recovery Mode.
stolenVehicle.remoteServicesSuspended: IMPORTANT! Once your vehicle is placed in Stolen Vehicle Recovery Mode, certain connected services will be suspended until you notify us that Stolen Vehicle Recovery Mode can be removed.
stolenVehicle.stolenVehicleLocationInfo: For your safety and the safety of others, we will only provide location information about stolen vehicles to the police. If your vehicle is equipped with vehicle immobilizer, this function can be activated only at the request of the local police and your authorization will be required to initiate all stolen vehicle services. The vehicle immobilizer function will prevent the vehicle from being started once the ignition is turned off.
stolenVehicle.stolenVehicleNote: NOTE: We will not continue to try to locate your vehicle after seven days from the time you first report it stolen, and we cannot guarantee that we will find it. You may request one additional seven-day extension, after which we will cease any efforts to locate your vehicle. We also are not required to try to find your vehicle for the purpose of locating a person. We will only provide stolen vehicle location service for your vehicle to an authorized third party, which means only you or an authorized user of legal age listed on your account, a government entity pursuant to a valid court order or other official governmental action.

serviceReminder.serviceHistoryDue: and service history you may be due for the following maintenance interval:
serviceReminder.noServiceReminders: There are currently no service reminders
serviceReminder.recommendedIntervals: The most accurate recommended maintenance intervals are based on mileage or time elapsed since last service - whichever occurs first. For simplicity, the intervals shown are based on mileage only and are the recommended minimums. More frequent maintenance may be needed depending on road conditions, weather and individual driving habits*, to name a few. See your Warranty & Maintenance Booklet for more details.
serviceReminder.severeDrivingListItem2: Driving on rough and/ or muddy roads.
serviceReminder.severeDrivingListItem5: Driving in areas where road salts or other corrosive materials are used.
serviceReminder.mileageDescription2: If you have an active SUBARU STARLINK<sup>®</sup> subscription, your mileage will be updated automatically every ignition off. Time for the maintenance schedule is calculated from the original sale date of the vehicle, or if not on file with your preferred dealer, from January of the model year of the vehicle. You may still be notified about upcoming maintenance for your vehicle, even if you've had it serviced elsewhere.
serviceReminder.mileageDescription3: MySubaru provides an estimated mileage in an effort to give timely maintenance notifications. If you have your vehicle serviced at an authorized Subaru dealer, your mileage will be updated automatically afterwards. Time for the maintenance schedule is calculated from the original sale date of the vehicle, or if not on file with your preferred dealer, from January of the model year of the vehicle. You may still be notified about upcoming maintenance for your vehicle, even if you've had it serviced elsewhere.

serviceHistory.info: This is your personal Service History page. Use this page to record maintenance work, repairs, accessory installation or any other information regarding your Subaru vehicle history.
serviceHistory.noteDescription: Note: It can take up to 30 days for records that are automatically added to appear in your records. Your preferred dealer may still notify you about upcoming services for your vehicle, even if you've had it serviced elsewhere.

whatsNew.title: What's New
whatsNew.autoLoginDescription: You now have the ability to automatically log in to the MySubaru App for easier access to the features you love. To enable, select "Remember Username/Password" on the log-in screen. To disable the setting, be sure to manually log out using the main menu.
whatsNew.autoLoginDescription2: To learn more about Auto Login please visit the FAQ page.
whatsNew.shortcutsDescriptionApple: All capable iPhone users will now have access to an even faster way to complete frequent tasks by using 3D touch!
whatsNew.shortcutsDescriptionAndroid: All capable Android users will now have access to an even faster way to complete frequent tasks by using Force touch!
whatsNew.biometricsDescription: We now have a faster, more convenient way to complete remote functions on your app! Simply set up
whatsNew.biometricsDescriptionContinued: when prompted on the PIN screen and you will be able to send remote features even faster.
whatsNew.crossCountryVacation: Search destinations or create multistop trips for an everyday errand or a cross-country vacation.
whatsNew.saveItForFuture: Once you've outlined your trip, send it directly to your vehicle or save it for future use.
whatsNew.trackYourFavoriteLocations: Keep track of your favorite locations for quick, convenient navigation.

alertMessage.alertContent: The health and safety of our customers and communities is always our top priority. Please check your dealer's website for the latest updates on their response to COVID-19, including safety efforts and impacts to hours of operation. Keeping your vehicle maintained and running is an essential service, particularly for those on the front lines in healthcare and other critical areas. Now and always, we are here to help. For additional resources, contact our Customer Care Department at 1 (800) 894-4212.

driverProfileLanding.welcomeMessage: Create a custom driver profile for your vehicle. A driver profile allows you to set in-vehicle preferences from MySubaru such as the language on your in-vehicle touchscreen display, key fob settings and more. You can set up to 2 profiles and any authorized users on your vehicle can set and send their own driver profile.
driverProfileLanding.footnote: We've created a default profile for you based on your vehicle's factory settings.
driverProfileLanding.loadingError: There is an error retrieving your driver profiles at the moment. Please try again later.

driverProfileSetting.languageContent: Select the language displayed inside your vehicle
driverProfileSetting.drivingUnitsContent: Select how you would like to see your distance traveled, speed and remaining fuel inside your vehicle. Hint: Imperial is the most common in the US.
driverProfileSetting.tempUnitsContent: Select how you would like to see temperature displayed in your vehicle.
driverProfileSetting.tirePressureUnitContent: Select how you would like to see your tire pressure unit measurement displayed in your vehicle. Hint: Pounds per square inch (PSI) is the most common in the US.
driverProfileSetting.maxAnniversariesWarning: A maximum of 5 Anniversaries can be added
driverProfileSetting.maxBirthdayWarning: A maximum of 5 birthdays can be added
driverProfileSetting.hintMessage: This could be your dogs adoption day, a wedding anniversary, or the day you brought your Subaru.
driverProfileSetting.maxAnniversariesError: maximum of five (5) anniversaries may be added.
driverProfileSetting.interiorLightContent: Set how ong you would like your interior lights to remain illuminated when you enter or exit your vehicle.
driverProfileSetting.lightSensitivityContent: Select the sensitivity level that controls whether the instrument panel illumination, headlights, parking lights, front side marker lights, rear side marker lights, taillights and license plat lighting turns ON and OFF based off the level of ambient light.
driverProfileSetting.welcomeLightApprochingContent: Select the timing of the welcome lighting function which turns on the low beam headlight for safe and convenient approaching to your vehicle at night or in a dark location.
driverProfileSetting.welcomeLightingLeavingContent: Select the timing of the welcome lighting function which turns on the low beam headlight for safe and convenient exiting of your vehicle at night or in a dark location.
driverProfileSetting.wiperLinkContent: When the headlight control switch is in the “AUTO” position in your vehicle, the headlights will automatically turn on when the windshield wipers are on. Select whether to turn this feature on or off in your vehicle.
driverProfileSetting.steeringResponsiveContent: Steering Responsive Headlights (SRH) is a function that automatically moves the headlight beam to the left or right in accordance with the steering angle and vehicle speed. This function helps to improve the visibility at night by illuminating the road ahead at corners and intersections. Select whether to turn this feature on or off.
driverProfileSetting.audibleSignalContent: Select whether to turn on or off the audible alert when the doors are locked and unlocked.
driverProfileSetting.hazardWarningContent: Select whether to turn on or off the lights flashing when the doors lock and unlock.
driverProfileSetting.laneChangerContent: Select whether to turn on or off the enhanced functionality of the turn signal lever which enables a mode where a single touch makes the indicators blink 3 times.
driverProfileSetting.rearSeatContent: Select whether to display a reminder in your vehicle if you may have left something in the rear seat. You also have the option to receive notifications from STARLINK<sup>®</sup> via email, text, or push. Tap the “Edit Communication Preferences” link to customize your notifications.
driverProfileSetting.autoDoorLockContent: Select whether to automatically lock your doors when you start driving your vehicle.
driverProfileSetting.autoDoorUnlockContent: Select whether to automatically unlock your doors when you park your vehicle.
driverProfileSetting.periodicRestNotificationContent: Select whether to enable Periodic Rest Reminders in your vehicle.
driverProfileSetting.rearDefrosterContent: Select the duration of your Rear Defroster to turn off after 15 minutes or to remain on until you manually turn it off.
driverProfileSetting.homeScreenShortcutContent: Select to turn the home screen shortcuts function on or off. Shortcut icons for various functions can be added to the home screen.
driverProfileSetting.welcomeScreenContent: Select whether to display the welcome motion graphic upon entry of your vehicle.
driverProfileSetting.goodbyeScreenContent: Select whether to display the goodbye motion graphic upon entry of your vehicle.
driverProfileSetting.gaugeContent: Select whether to have the initial movement of the meter needles and gauge needles that occurs when the ignition switch is turned to the “ON” position.
driverProfileSetting.meterInformationContent: Select which type of information you would like shown on your in-vehicle display.
driverProfileSetting.turnByTurnContent: Select whether to show Turn by Turn Interruptions on your in-vehicle display.
driverProfileSetting.anniversaryReminderContent: Select whether to display anniversary reminders that you have added on your in-vehicle display
driverProfileSetting.birthdayReminderContent: Select whether to display birthday reminders that you have added on your in-vehicle display
driverProfileSetting.useSearchField: Please use the search field above to select your work address.

airbag.description: The Airbag System light indicates there might be a potential problem with your vehicle's Supplemental Restraint System, which includes the airbags and seatbelts. For your safety, we recommend a full system check. Please contact your Subaru Retailer right away.

awd.description: The AWD light indicates there might be a potential problem with the All-Wheel Drive system in your vehicle. Two common things can adversely affect the AWD: excessively low tire inflation pressure; and driving on tires with different diameters, such as using the temporary spare tire longer than recommended. For your peace of mind, and ours, please contact your Subaru Retailer as soon as possible.

abs.description: The ABS light indicates there might be a potential problem with your vehicle's Anti-Lock Braking System. Your vehicle's conventional brake system will continue to operate normally. To be safe, you should contact your Subaru Retailer as soon as possible.

oilTemp.description: The AT Oil Temperature light indicates there might be a potential problem with your vehicle's automatic transmission. If it's illuminated but not flashing, the transmission fluid may be too hot. If it is flashing, it might mean the transmission control system is not working properly. In either case, you should contact your Subaru Retailer right away.

blindspot.description: The Blind-Spot Detection/Rear Cross Traffic System light indicates there might be a potential problem with your vehicle's peripheral sensors, they may not be operating. Please contact your Subaru Retailer as soon as possible.

chargeSystem.description: If this light illuminates when the engine is running, it may indicate that the charging system is not working properly. If the light illuminates while driving or does not turn off after the engine starts, stop the engine at the first safe opportunity and check the alternator belt. If the belt is loose, broken or if the belt is in good condition but the light remains illuminated, contact your nearest SUBARU dealer immeditely.

engineFail.description: The Check Engine light indicates a potential problem with your vehicle's engine control system. It could be something minor like a loose gas cap, or it may indicate a more serious condition. We recommend that you contact your Subaru Retailer right away.

ebd.description: The Brake light indicates there might be a potential problem with your vehicle's brake system. If your parking brake is released, it could be the brake fluid is low or the brake pads are worn. If at all in doubt, about whether the brakes are operating properly, do not drive the vehicle. Have your vehicle towed to the nearest Subaru retailer for repair. Please contact your Subaru Retailer, who can help diagnose and repair your vehicle.

pkgBrake.description: The Electronic Parking Brake light flashes when the system is malfunctioning. If the light flashes, promptly park in a safe location right away and contact your Subaru Retailer. The light remains illuminated when the parking brake cannot be released even if the parking brake switch is pushed. If at all in doubt, about whether the brakes are operating properly, do not drive the vehicle. Have your vehicle towed to the nearest Subaru retailer for repair. Please contact your Subaru Retailer, who can help diagnose and repair your vehicle.

oilWarning.description: The Engine Oil Level light indicates the oil level may be low. Park your vehicle on a level surface, turn off the vehicle, wait at least 5 minutes and then check the engine oil level. If it's low, add oil according to the directions in your Owner's Manual. If the light does not turn off after you add oil, or if the light illuminates and the engine oil level is normal when checked, you should contact your Subaru Retailer as soon as possible.

eyesight.description: The EyeSight System light indicates there might be a potential problem with the EyeSight Driver Assist Technology in your vehicle. The system monitors Pre-Collision Warning, Braking and Throttle Management, Lane Departure, and Adaptive Cruise Control. If EyeSight senses something is off, it sends a warning alert. For your peace of mind, and ours, please contact your Subaru Retailer right away.

hybridSystem.description: The Hybrid light indicates there might be a potential problem with your vehicle's hybrid electric drive system. For your safety, we recommend a full system check. Please contact a Subaru Retailer as soon as possible.

iss.description:
The Auto Start Stop warning light will flash when the Auto Start Stop system is malfunctioning. We recommend that you contact your authorized SUBARU dealer for an inspection.

If the Auto Start Stop warning light does not turn off after the engine has started, the Auto Start Stop system may be malfunctioning. We recommend that you contact your authorized SUBARU dealer for an inspection.

After the vehicle is stopped, the engine may not automatically stop under the following conditions.
  • The vehicle is stopped on a road with a steep slope.
  • The vehicle is stopped by hard braking.
  • Negative pressure in the brake booster is not sufficient.
  • The brake pedal is not fully depressed.

oilPres.description: If the Oil Pressure light illuminates when the engine is running, it may indicate that the engine oil pressure is low and the lubricating system is not working properly. If the light illuminates while driving or does not turn off after the engine starts, stop the engine at the first safe opportunity on a level surface, wait at least 5 minutes after stopping the engine, and check the engine oil level. If the oil level is low, add oil immediately. If the engine oil is at the proper level but the light remains illuminated, contact your nearest Subaru Retailer right away.

passairbag.description: The Front Passenger Airbag System light indicates there might be a potential problem with your vehicle's front passenger Supplemental Restraint System, which includes the airbags and seatbelts. Until you have this condition resolved, we recommend to not have anyone sit in the front passenger seat. For your safety, we recommend a full system check. Please contact your Subaru Retailer right away.

warning.description: The Front Passenger Airbag System light indicates there might be a potential problem with your vehicle's front passenger Supplemental Restraint System, which includes the airbags and seatbelts. Until you have this condition resolved, we recommend to not have anyone sit in the front passenger seat. For your safety, we recommend a full system check. Please contact your Subaru Retailer right away.

epas.description: The Power Steering Warning Light indicates there might be a potential problem with your vehicle's power steering. You may notice some resistance when steering, but you'll still be able to control your vehicle. Drive carefully to the nearest Subaru Retailer and have the vehicle inspected right away.

revBrake.description: The RAB System light indicates there might be a problem with your vehicle's Reverse Automatic Braking System. Please contact your Subaru Retailer as soon as possible.

telematics.description: The STARLINK<sup>®</sup> Emergency Service such as Automatic Crash Notification, SOS call, Stolen Vehicle Locator and Enhanced Roadside Assistance may not be available. Since these functions deal primarily with your safety, security and remote services, it's important you stay connected. Please contact your Subaru Retailer right away.

tpms.description: The TPMS light indicates one or more of your tires is underinflated. You should stop and check your tires as soon as possible, and inflate them to the proper pressure. Underinflation reduces fuel efficiency and tire life, and may affect the vehicle's handling and stopping ability. After you add air and drive the vehicle at least 25 mph (40 km/h), the TPMS will re-check the inflation pressures to see if they are above the severe low-pressure threshold. If the warning light doesn't turn off a few minutes later, you should contact your Subaru Retailer as soon as possible.

vdc.description: The VDC light indicates there might be a potential problem with the system that monitors and analyzes steering angle, engine speed and braking conditions. For your peace of mind, and ours, please contact your Subaru Retailer as soon as possible.

washer.description: The Windshield Washer Fluid Level light indicates the windshield washer fluid is low. It's easy to do go for it, just make sure you turn off your engine first. For a quick reference on adding windshield washer fluid, check the Owner's Manual. For additional assistance, please visit your Subaru Retailer and ask for help.

srh.description: The SRH light indicates there might be a potential problem with your vehicle’s Steering Responsive Headlights. SRH automatically moves the headlight beam to the left or right in accordance with the steering angle. This function helps to improve the visibility at night by illuminating the road ahead at corners and intersections. For your peace of mind, and ours, please contact your Subaru Retailer as soon as possible.

ahbl.description: The Automatic Headlight Beam Leveler indicator light illuminates when the automatic headlight beam leveler does not operate normally. The LED headlights produce more light than conventional halogen headlights. When the vehicle is carrying a heavy load and the headlight beams are angled upwards, the driver of an oncoming vehicle may experience glare. To prevent this, the automatic headlight beam leveler adjusts the headlights to the optimum height automatically depending on the load the vehicle is carrying. For your peace of mind, and ours, please contact your Subaru Retailer as soon as possible.

vehicleDiagnostics.disclaimer: Not all vehicle warning lights are accounted for within the Vehicle Status Health Report. Always refer to your vehicle for the most up to date information.
